introduction: In this video, we will be discussing building a job board app that can be used as a real startup. We will start with an MVP that consists of a single data feed from a job board API. We will use React, Material UI, and Node.js with Redis for data storage. We will also use a cron job to fetch jobs and refresh them at a certain interval. The app will filter down jobs to get only junior software engineer positions.

sections.title: Section 1: Setting up the project
content: Install Node.js and npm
Create a new directory for the project
Initialize a new Node.js project
Install necessary dependencies

sections.title: Section 2: Building the frontend
content: Create a new React app using create-react-app
Install Material UI for styling
Set up components for the job list and job details
Implement pagination for large job lists

sections.title: Section 3: Implementing the backend
content: Set up an Express server
Connect to Redis for data storage
Implement the cron job for fetching jobs
Filter down jobs to get only junior software engineer positions

sections.title: Section 4: Deploying the app
content: Set up a domain name and hosting
Configure Nginx as a reverse proxy
Install PM2 for process management
Deploy the app to a server

sections.title: Section 5: Improving the app
content: Add more data feeds for job listings
Implement a more advanced job filtering algorithm
Add monitoring and logging for better performance
Improve the UI/UX for a better user experience
